title: Design Considerations for Protocol Extensions
abstract:
This document discusses architectural issues related to the extensibility of
Internet protocols, with a focus on design considerations.  It is intended to
assist designers of both base protocols and extensions.  Case studies are
included.  A companion document, RFC 4775 (BCP 125), discusses procedures
relating to the extensibility of IETF protocols.  This document is not an 
Internet Standards Track specification; it is published for informational 
purposes.
